Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

::Aerotaur::
       He turned around eager to find his ghoulish guide but saw only stone 
walls where his voice was echoing from.  He began surveying his surroundings, 
scanning the horizon until his gaze is drawn to an average sized nondescript 
building entirely similar to those around it except for a small statue on 
it's roof.  A statue of himself.  "No, it cannot be.  Why would they have 
something like that?  For that matter why is this Inner-Cybertron."  He 
focuses his eyes more closely on the points of light in the sky only to 
realize that they are not in fact stars but the lit tips of incredibly high 
stalactites.

       The realization came to him as a bit of a shock but he shook it off 
and proceeded toward the building with his statue.  He walks inside and is 
quickly ushered into a large room.  A rather scrawny bot with no obvious 
weapons comes into the room.  Aerotaur was still tense but the bot was polite 
and to the point.  "You're wondering about the statue.  It is of you.  Well, 
more precisely, another you.  You, in this timeline, unite the peoples of 
Cybertron after many battles.  But that is not your destiny.  Actually, you 
see... We have a bit of a problem here.  One from your timeline fell into our 
world... We need you to take him back.  He was causing a bit of a 
disturbance."  He hands Aerotaur a small control box with one button on it.  
"When you return to your world you must push that button and he will 
rematerialize somewhere on the planet.  After that the circuit will fry and 
we will never meet again."

       Aerotaur takes this news in stoically and nods his understanding.  He 
is then whisked off to a small portal and shoved through to land back in his 
cave.  He solemnly presses the button and, on a small deserted island a 
groaning body appears.

--part1_57.18a9cfdf.2b8c48ff_boundary
